title: Here's what would happen if Americans could easily look up everyone's salary
text:
Dow sinks as Boeing, Goldman's stocks slump, but tech stocks aim for gains in September's final session

U.S. stocks rise Thursday morning, as Wall Street aims to wrap up the last trading day of September and the quarter, as investors await another appearance by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, who will appear before the House Financial Services Committee. See full story.

Facebook grilled in Senate hearing on protecting kids online

"Facebook has weaponized childhood vulnerabilities" in its ruthless pursuit of profits

---

despite knowing the deep harm it causes, Sen. Richard Blumenthal (D., Conn.) said in an opening statement. "Facebook has evaded, misled and deceived." See full story.

Congress set to act to prevent government shutdown as debt-limit brawl continues

With a midnight deadline fast approaching, lawmakers are planning votes Thursday on a short-term spending bill to keep the federal government operating through early December. See full story.

Congress is about to kill this popular retirement tax move

Say goodbye to Roth IRA conversions. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

Ahead of Walt Disney World's 50th anniversary, the company provided more details about the immersive, cruise-style experience based on the popular film franchise. See full story.
